text.author: Stuart Heritage
text.description: In his final State of the Union address, Barack Obama said that if anyone doubted his ability to uphold justice, they should consult the former al-Qaida leader. Does this make him the toughest-talking politician ever? Let’s find out
text.tags: Politics,US news,UK news,Boris Johnson,Margaret Thatcher,Ed Miliband,Hillary Clinton,Silvio Berlusconi,Barack Obama,Vladimir Putin,World news
text.title: Who’s the hardest politician? Ask Osama bin Laden ...

main.p:
“You turn if you want to. The lady’s not for turning.”
I literally just turned around. Nothing happened. Big whoop. 1/10

“I watched, for the 17th and hopefully the last time, The Guns of Navarone on New Year’s Eve. I always watch just in case the explosives don’t go off in the end.”
We get it Dave, you like explosions. Calm down. 1/10

“Am I tough enough? Hell, yes, I’m tough enough.”
An especially poor effort, especially given that Miliband said it in the voice of the kid from that McCain oven chips advert. 2/10

“Go back to your constituencies, and prepare for government!”
Apparently some of his audience are still at home preparing for government, like those Japanese soldiers who didn’t know the war ended. 2/10

“No one obeys the speed limit except a motorised rickshaw.”
In an ideal world, Boris would have left a pause after “limit”, put on his aviators, finished the quote and then sped off on his motorbike to the strains of Bad to the Bone, leaving a befuddled policeman in his wake. But still, points for trying. 6/10

“When you can’t make them see the light, make them feel the heat.”
Like Boris, this quote needed an ellipsis, a flip-down welder’s mask and a blowtorch for it to really pop. 6/10

“Every nation in every region now has a decision to make. Either you are with us, or you are with the terrorists.”
It’s the “in every region” that seals this one. Scandinavia, Bush is looking right at you. 7/10

“I can’t stand whining.”
This is Clinton as Alan Sugar at the start of The Apprentice, and therefore more terrifying than she’s ever been. 7/10

“We shall fight on the beaches.”
Have you ever tried to fight someone on a beach? All that sand means you can’t really get enough purchase. Churchill really meant business here. 8/10

“Russia doesn’t negotiate with terrorists. It destroys them.”
This is how you do it. Chilling. 9/10

“When asked if they would like to have sex with me, 30% of women said ‘yes’, while the other 70% replied: ‘What, again?’”
Legitimately, the scariest words ever spoken by a politician. Obama, you never stood a chance. 10/10
